The whole power screw acceptor broke out.
Not sure how that happened… Anyone else?

Over-torque would result in this common failure mode (although there are other failure modes like a quality issue that could also result. Over torque is just high on the list of items in teams control that could result in this outcome)

Are you using the recommended torque wrenches?

I have had the same issue installing a brand new X60 but it was with one of the CAN screw terminals. We used the proper torque tool from CTRE and plan to contact them once we have time. Worst case, I get to repair a motor for use on a practice bot.

I plan on putting in a ticket with WCP.
There’s also some electrical conductive epoxy I found online.

What? Where would you put this epoxy?

I can tell you without looking at it even that it won’t be conductive ENOUGH and you will have a high-resistance joint and a hotspot if you try to use this to repair the screw port to the PCB.

The proper repair would be to solder it back down to the board.
